body: Seems correct. I will make a PR tomorrow if no else wants/will do it
@SplotyCode thanks a lot... will review once done

issue.title: Allow to specify KeyStore type in SslContext

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
As brought up in #8998, JKS can be substantially faster than pkcs12, JDK's new default. Without an option to set the KeyStore type you must change the configuration of the entire JVM which is impractical.

This PR adds the possibility to set the KeyStore type!

body:
Why is there a null parameter for setting the client keystore type?

https://github.com/netty/netty/commit/5a27f2f78b4f9630ca71ba46e75332009fb5f785#diff-71806bf8745a8afbcc579df0168dd5a6R289

I'm experiencing errors right now because the wrong keystore is created for client authentication. They only workaround I have found so far is creating my own KeyManagerFactory.
@bergerst if you think there is a bug or there is something that can be improved please provide a pr.

issue.title: Set keystoreType for JdkSslClientContext Keystores

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

In the PR #9003, the issue #8998 was supposedly solved. But actually the fix only made it so the TrustManager can use the specified keystore type instead of also supporting it in the KeyManagerFactory.

In my environment, we are using PKCS#11 Keys which are then rejected by the PKCS#12 keystore. A PKCS#12 keystore is created since the keystoreType was set to null by the code from the mentioned PR.

Modification:

Do not ignore the keystoreType parameter during the creation of the JdkSslClientContext KeyManagerFactory.

Result:

Fixes #8998.
